meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the establishment made an electronic application for registration to the registering officer within sixty days from the date of applicability of this Code?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments to which this Code applies (generally 10 or more employees).
simplified_guidance:
1. Determine if the establishment falls under the coverage of the Code (10+ employees).
2. Access the designated electronic portal for registration.
3. Submit the application within 60 days of the Code becoming applicable or the establishment commencing.
4. Ensure the Certificate of Registration is generated and saved.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Electronic Certificate of Registration issued by the Registering Officer.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Proof of application submission date vs establishment start date; Challan for late fees if applicable.

legal_text: Every employer of any establishment,-(a) which comes into existence after the commencement of this Code; and (b) to which this Code shall apply, shall, within sixty days from the date of such applicability of this Code, make an application electronically to the registering officer appointed by the appropriate Government... for the registration of such establishment.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer intimated the registering officer electronically within thirty days of any change in ownership, management, or other registration particulars?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to registered establishments where a change in ownership, management, or registered particulars has occurred.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if any changes occurred in ownership, management, or details submitted during registration.
2. Log in to the electronic registration portal.
3. Submit the intimation of change within 30 days of the occurrence.
4. Obtain the amended certificate of registration.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Amended Certificate of Registration; Electronic filing receipt of the amendment application.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Correspondence regarding changes vs date of online update.

legal_text: Any change in the ownership or management or in any particulars referred to in sub-section (2) which occurs after the registration of an establishment under this Code, shall be intimated by the employer electronically to the registering officer within thirty days of such change in such form as may be prescribed by the Central Government...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: In the event of closing the establishment, did the employer inform the registering officer and certify payment of all dues to workers within thirty days?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments that have ceased operations or closed down.
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure all dues to workers are paid fully upon closing the establishment.
2. Prepare a certificate confirming payment of all dues.
3. Inform the registering officer electronically within 30 days of closing.
4. Verify that the registration certificate is cancelled by the officer.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Electronic acknowledgement of closure intimation; Certification of dues payment.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of closure vs Date of intimation.

legal_text: The employer of an establishment shall, within thirty days of the closing of the establishment- (a) inform the closing of such establishment; and (b) certify payment of all dues to the workers employed in such establishment, to the registering officer in such manner as may be prescribed...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer sent a notice of commencement of operation electronically prior to starting operations in a factory, mine, or construction work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories, mines, contract labor, and building/construction establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare the notice of commencement in the prescribed form.
2. Submit the notice electronically to the prescribed authority before operations begin.
3. Retain the electronic acknowledgement.
4. Ensure notice of cessation is also sent if operations stop.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of the electronically submitted Notice of Commencement (Form/Intimation).
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of actual commencement vs Date of notice submission.

legal_text: No employer of an establishment being factory or mine or relating to contract labour or building or other construction work shall use such establishment to commence the operation of any industry, trade, business, manufacturing or occupation thereon without sending notice of such purpose in such form and manner and to such authority and within such time as may be prescribed...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the establishment possess a valid common license or single license if it operates as a factory, industrial premises for beedi/cigar, or engages contract labor?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Factories, Beedi & Cigar establishments, and Establishments engaging Contract Labor.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the establishment requires a license under Factory, Contract Labor, or Beedi/Cigar provisions.
2. Apply for a Common License or Single License electronically.
3. Ensure the license is valid (typically 5 years) and not expired.
4. Display the license number/details as required.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Valid Common License or Single License document; Renewal application if expired.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: License expiry date vs Renewal application date.

legal_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Code, any person desirous of obtaining common licence in respect of a factory, industrial premises for beedi and cigar work and for engaging contract workers or any combination thereof or single licence for any one of them under this Code shall make an application electronically or otherwise to such authority as may be designated...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer issued an appointment letter to every employee with the prescribed information?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all employers and employees within the establishment.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify that every employee has received an appointment letter.
2. Ensure the letter contains all prescribed information (wages, designation, etc.).
3. For employees employed before this Code, ensure letters were issued within three months of commencement.
4. Maintain acknowledgement copies in personal files.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of issued appointment letters with employee acknowledgement.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of appointment vs. Date of letter issuance.

legal_text: Every employer shall... issue a letter of appointment to every employee on his appointment in the establishment, with such information and in such form as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government and where an employee has not been issued such appointment letter on or before the commencement of this Code, he shall, within three months of such commencement, be issued such appointment letter.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the employer provide free annual health examinations or tests to employees of the prescribed age or class?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to employees of specific age groups or classes as prescribed by the appropriate Government.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify employees eligible for annual health exams based on age or job class.
2. Arrange for medical examinations free of cost to these employees.
3. Record the dates and results of these examinations.
4. Ensure confidentiality of medical records is maintained.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Health examination reports; Invoices/proof of payment by employer.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Gap between due date of annual exam and actual exam date.

legal_text: Every employer shall... provide such annual health examination or test free of costs to such employees of such age or such class of employees of establishments or such class of establishments, as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the disposal of hazardous and toxic waste, including e-waste, ensured by the employer?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments generating hazardous, toxic, or e-waste.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify all sources of hazardous, toxic, and electronic waste.
2. Implement a disposal system compliant with environmental standards.
3. Maintain manifests or certificates of disposal from authorized agencies.
4. Ensure no accumulation of waste creates a hazard at the workplace.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Waste disposal manifests; Contracts with authorized disposal agencies.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Observation of accumulated waste; Dates on disposal records.

legal_text: Every employer shall... ensure the disposal of hazardous and toxic waste including disposal of e-waste.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer sent notice of any accident causing death or bodily injury preventing work for 48+ hours to the prescribed authorities?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when an accident occurs causing death or bodily injury preventing work for 48 hours or more.
simplified_guidance:
1. Immediately identify if an accident results in death or >48 hours absence.
2. Prepare the accident notice in the prescribed form.
3. Submit the notice to the prescribed authority within the specified timeline.
4. Record the accident in the establishment's accident register.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Accident Notice sent to authorities; Accident Register.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of accident vs. Date of notice submission.

legal_text: Where at any place in an establishment, an accident occurs which causes death, or which causes any bodily injury by reason of which the person injured is prevented from working for a period of forty-eight hours or more immediately following the accident... employer... shall send notice thereof to such authorities, in such manner and within such time, as may be prescribed...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer sent notice of any dangerous occurrences to the prescribed authorities?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when a dangerous occurrence (as defined/prescribed) happens, regardless of bodily injury.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify events classified as 'dangerous occurrences' (e.g., explosions, fire, collapse).
2. Send notice to the authorities in the prescribed form and timeline.
3. Document the occurrence internally for investigation.
4. Ensure corrective actions are taken to prevent recurrence.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Dangerous Occurrence Notice; Internal incident reports.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of occurrence vs. Date of notice.

legal_text: Where in an establishment there is any dangerous occurrence of such nature, (whether causing any bodily injury or disability, or not) the employer shall send notice thereof to such authorities, and in such form and within such time, as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer sent notice to authorities regarding any worker contracting a disease specified in the Third Schedule?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when a worker contracts a disease listed in the Third Schedule (Notifiable Diseases).
simplified_guidance:
1. Monitor health records for Third Schedule diseases (e.g., lead poisoning, silicosis).
2. Upon confirmation, send notice to the prescribed authorities.
3. Ensure the notice format and timeline comply with rules.
4. Take measures to investigate the source and protect other workers.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Disease Notice sent to authorities; Medical records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Diagnosis date vs. Notice date.

legal_text: Where any worker in an establishment contracts any disease specified in the Third Schedule, the employer of the establishment shall send notice thereof to such authorities, and in such form and within such time, as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer/importer ensured that articles used in the establishment are designed and constructed to be safe and without risk to health?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to persons who design, manufacture, import, or supply articles for use in the establishment.
simplified_guidance:
1. Ensure all machinery/articles have safety design certifications.
2. If imported, verify conformity to Indian or higher international standards.
3. Obtain and maintain information/manuals regarding safe use.
4. Conduct tests/examinations to ensure safety during use.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Design certificates; Testing reports; User manuals indicating safety conditions.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Absence of safety manuals for machinery.

legal_text: Every person who designs, manufactures, imports or supplies any article for use in any establishment shall- (a) ensure so far as is reasonably practicable, that the article is so designed and constructed in the establishment as to be safe and without risk to the health of the workers when properly used...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Did the employer take immediate remedial action upon being informed of an imminent danger by an employee?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when an employee or Safety Committee member reports an imminent danger.
simplified_guidance:
1. Establish a mechanism for employees to report imminent dangers.
2. Upon receipt of a report, investigate immediately.
3. Take remedial action if danger exists.
4. Send a report of the action taken to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator forthwith.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Incident reports; Action taken reports sent to Inspector-cum-Facilitator; Safety Committee minutes.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Date of report vs. Date of remedial action.

legal_text: The employer... shall take immediate remedial action if he is satisfied about the existence of such imminent danger and send a report forthwith of the action taken to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator in such manner as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has a Safety Committee been constituted with equal or greater representation of workers compared to employer representatives?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments required by general or special order of the appropriate Government (typically larger establishments or hazardous processes).
simplified_guidance:
1. Check if the establishment falls under the threshold for mandatory Safety Committee (often 250+ or 500+ workers depending on rules).
2. Verify the constitution of the committee.
3. Ensure worker representatives equal or exceed employer representatives.
4. Review minutes of Safety Committee meetings.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Order constituting the Safety Committee; Minutes of meetings; List of members.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Gap in meeting dates or constitution date.

legal_text: The appropriate Government may... require any establishment or class of establishments to constitute in the prescribed manner a Safety Committee consisting of representatives of employers and workers engaged in such establishment in such manner that the number of representatives of workers on the Committee shall not be less than the number of representatives of the employer...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer appointed the prescribed number of qualified Safety Officers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to: (a) Factories with 500+ workers; (b) Hazardous factories with 250+ workers; (c) Construction work with 250+ workers; (d) Mines with 100+ workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Determine the worker count and nature of activity (Hazardous/Mine/Construction).
2. If thresholds (e.g., 250/500/100) are met, appoint qualified Safety Officers.
3. Verify qualifications against prescribed rules.
4. Ensure they perform statutory duties.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Appointment letters of Safety Officers; Degree/Diploma certificates of officers.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Vacancy period in Safety Officer position.

legal_text: In every establishment which is a- (a) factory wherein five hundred workers or more; or (b) factory carrying on hazardous process wherein two hundred fifty workers or more; or (c) building or other construction work wherein two hundred fifty workers or more; or (d) mine wherein one hundred workers or more, are ordinarily employed, the employer shall also appoint such number of safety officers...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the employer afford all facilities for safety and occupational health surveys conducted by authorized officers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments when a survey is ordered by the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or authorized officer.
simplified_guidance:
1. Receive notice of survey from the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or DG.
2. Provide access to plant, machinery, and records.
3. Allow collection of samples and data.
4. Ensure workers are made available for medical examination if required.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Survey reports acknowledged by employer; Records of samples taken.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Correspondence indicating refusal or delay in access.

legal_text: At any time during the normal working hours of an establishment or at any other time as he may deem necessary... conduct survey... and such employer shall afford all facilities for such survey, including facilities for the examination and testing of plant and machinery and collection of samples and other data relevant to the survey.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the establishment collect, compile, and analyze occupational safety and health statistics in the prescribed form?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments required to submit statistics to the Government.
simplified_guidance:
1. Maintain records of accidents, diseases, and safety incidents.
2. Compile statistics in the format prescribed by rules.
3. Analyze data to identify trends.
4. Submit data to State/Central Government as required.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Statistical returns filed; Internal safety analysis reports.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Gap in data records.

legal_text: For the purposes of this Code, the Central Government and the State Government shall collect, compile and analyse occupational safety and health statistics in such form and manner as may be prescribed.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the establishment maintained in a state of cleanliness and hygiene?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all employers responsible for maintaining the establishment.
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect all work areas, floors, and common areas for accumulation of dirt or refuse.
2. Verify the schedule of daily cleaning.
3. Ensure effective drainage systems where wet processes are used.
4. Check for painting/whitewashing records if prescribed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Cleaning schedules/logs; Visual cleanliness; Waste removal records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Observation of accumulated waste or dust.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing all or any of the following matters in the establishment or class of establishments, namely:-(i) cleanliness and hygiene;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are adequate ventilation, temperature, and humidity maintained in the workrooms?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments, especially factories and enclosed workspaces.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify that fresh air circulation is sufficient.
2. Check temperature gauges in workrooms involving thermal processes.
3. Ensure humidity levels are controlled if artificial humidification is used.
4. Confirm workers are not subjected to extreme discomfort.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Ventilation system maintenance records; Temperature/humidity logs.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Observation of stifling heat or lack of airflow.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (ii) ventilation, temperature and humidity;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the work environment kept free from dust, noxious gas, fumes, and other impurities?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments where manufacturing processes generate dust, fumes, or gases.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify processes generating dust or fumes.
2. Check for installation and operation of exhaust appliances near the source.
3. Ensure impurities are not inhaled by workers.
4. Verify air quality monitoring reports.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Air quality monitoring reports; Maintenance records of exhaust systems.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Visible dust clouds; Strong chemical odors.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (iii) environment free from dust, noxious gas, fumes and other impurities;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is adequate potable drinking water provided at convenient points?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Locate drinking water points.
2. Ensure they are sufficient for the number of employees.
3. Verify water potability test reports.
4. Ensure water points are marked in the local language.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Water potability test report; Visual check of water stations.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Empty dispensers; Lack of water connection.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (v) potable drinking water;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are adequate standards maintained to prevent overcrowding and provide sufficient space to employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments, particularly factories and offices.
simplified_guidance:
1. Assess the floor area per worker.
2. Ensure minimum cubic space requirements (often 9.9 to 14.2 cubic meters) are met.
3. Verify that machinery layout allows safe movement.
4. Check for posting of notices specifying maximum capacity per room.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Factory layout plans approved by authorities; Visual assessment of density.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Workers bumping into each other or machinery.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (vi) adequate standards to prevent overcrowding and to provide sufficient space to employees or other persons, as the case may be, employed therein;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is adequate lighting provided in every part of the establishment where workers are working or passing?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect lighting in work areas, corridors, and exits.
2. Ensure lighting is sufficient to prevent eye strain and accidents.
3. Check for emergency lighting systems.
4. Verify that glazed windows/skylights are clean.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Lux level survey reports; Maintenance log of lighting fixtures.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Dark corners; Flickering lights.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (vii) adequate lighting;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are sufficient latrine and urinal accommodations provided separately for male, female, and transgender employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Count the number of toilets/urinals against the number of employees.
2. Verify separate facilities for men, women, and transgender persons.
3. Ensure privacy, doors, and proper signage.
4. Check the hygiene and cleaning frequency of these facilities.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Cleaning logs; Ratio calculation of employees to toilets.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Dirty facilities; Broken locks; Lack of water.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (viii) sufficient arrangement for latrine and urinal accommodation to male, female and transgender employee separately and maintaining hygiene therein;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are effective arrangements made for the treatment of wastes and effluents?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments generating industrial waste or effluents.
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the Effluent Treatment Plant (ETP) or Sewage Treatment Plant (STP) if applicable.
2. Verify that discharge meets environmental standards.
3. Check records of waste quantity and treatment.
4. Ensure approval from the Pollution Control Board is valid.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Pollution Control Board consent orders; ETP/STP logbooks.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Untreated discharge; Non-functional treatment plant.

legal_text: Without prejudice to the generality of the power conferred under sub-section (1), the Central Government may prescribe for providing... (ix) effective arrangements for treatment of wastes and effluents;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are adequate and suitable washing facilities provided separately for male and female employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the washing facilities provided in the establishment.
2. Ensure facilities are separate for male and female employees.
3. Check that facilities are adequate in number based on the workforce size.
4. Verify they are accessible, clean, and maintained.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual verification of separate facilities; Cleaning schedules.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Shared facilities without separation; Broken fixtures.

legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide and maintain in his establishment such welfare facilities for the employees as may be prescribed by the Central Government, including,-(i) adequate and suitable facilities for washing to male and female employees separately;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are separate bathing places and locker rooms provided for male, female, and transgender employees?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments where prescribed (typically factories, mines, etc.).
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the establishment type requires bathing/locker facilities.
2. Verify the existence of separate lockers/bathing areas for male, female, and transgender employees.
3. Ensure security and privacy are maintained.
4. Check for hygiene and regular cleaning.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual verification of locker rooms and bathing facilities with signage.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Lack of transgender specific facilities; Inadequate lockers.

legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide... (ii) bathing places and locker rooms for male, female and transgender employees separately;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are sitting arrangements provided for all employees who are obliged to work in a standing position?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments where employees work in standing positions.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify roles that require continuous standing.
2. Verify if chairs or stools are provided near these workstations.
3. Ensure employees are permitted to sit when not actively engaged in standing work.
4. Check the condition and ergonomics of the seating.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual confirmation of seating availability.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Employees standing continuously without rest options.

legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide... (iv) sitting arrangements for all employees obliged to work in a standing position;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is a canteen facility provided in the establishment where one hundred or more workers (including contract labor) are ordinarily employed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with 100 or more workers (including contract labor).
simplified_guidance:
1. Calculate the total workforce including contract labor.
2. If >100, inspect the canteen facility.
3. Ensure it is hygienic, sufficient in size, and operational.
4. Verify compliance with any specific rules regarding food prices/management committee.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Canteen license/hygiene certificate; Photos of facility; Menu/Price list.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Worker count >100 but no canteen exists.

legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide... (v) facilities of canteen in an establishment for employees thereof, wherein one hundred or more workers including contract labourers are ordinarily employed;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are adequate first-aid boxes or cupboards with contents readily accessible during all working hours?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Locate first-aid boxes in the establishment.
2. Ensure they are accessible during all shifts.
3. Verify contents against the prescribed list (unexpired).
4. Confirm a trained person is in charge if required.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Checklist of first-aid box contents; Expiry dates of medicines.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Empty boxes; Expired items; Locked/inaccessible boxes.

legal_text: The employer shall be responsible to provide... (vii) adequate first-aid boxes or cupboards with contents readily accessible during all working hours;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is an ambulance room provided where more than five hundred workers are ordinarily employed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories, mines, building/construction work with >500 workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify total worker count (if >500).
2. Inspect the ambulance room premises.
3. Ensure it is equipped with prescribed medical equipment and staff (nurse/doctor).
4. Check availability during working hours.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photos of Ambulance Room; Staff attendance records; Equipment inventory.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Room used for other purposes; No medical staff present.

legal_text: The Central Government may also prescribe... (i) ambulance room in every factory, mine, building or other construction work wherein more than five hundred workers are ordinarily employed;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are separate shelters or rest-rooms and lunch-rooms provided for male, female, and transgender employees where required?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories/mines with >50 workers and motor transport undertakings with night halts.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check worker count (>50).
2. Verify provision of adequate shelters/rest-rooms and lunch-rooms.
3. Ensure separation for male, female, and transgender employees.
4. Check ventilation, lighting, and cleanliness.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual verification of rooms; Signage indicating separate use.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Workers eating at workstations; No separate facilities.

legal_text: The Central Government may also prescribe... (iii) adequate, suitable and separate shelters or rest-rooms for male, female and transgender employees and lunch-room in every factory and mine wherein more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed and in motor transport undertaking wherein employee is required to halt at night;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has a Welfare Officer been appointed where two hundred and fifty or more workers are ordinarily employed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factory, mine, or plantation with 250+ workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker count (if >250).
2. Check appointment letter of the Welfare Officer.
3. Verify the officer possesses the prescribed qualifications.
4. Ensure the officer is discharging statutory duties.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Appointment letter; Qualification certificates of Welfare Officer.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Vacancy in Welfare Officer position.

legal_text: The Central Government may also prescribe... (iv) the appointment of welfare officer in every factory, mine or plantation wherein two hundred and fifty or more workers are ordinarily employed and the qualification, conditions of service and duties of such welfare officer;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is a crche facility provided where more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments with >50 workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check total worker count (>50).
2. Inspect the crche facility (onsite or pooled/common facility).
3. Ensure it serves children <6 years.
4. Verify standards of safety, hygiene, and supervision.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Crche registration/photos; Agreement with common facility if applicable.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: No facility despite threshold; Unsafe conditions.

legal_text: The Central Government may make rules to provide for the facility of creche having suitable room or rooms for the use of children under the age of six years of the employees... in establishments wherein more than fifty workers are ordinarily employed...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the daily working limit of eight hours strictly adhered to for all workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments covered under the Code.
simplified_guidance:
1. Review attendance registers and time logs.
2. Verify that no worker is rostered or allowed to work beyond 8 hours in a single day.
3. Check shift schedules to ensure they comply with the 8-hour cap.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Attendance Register; Shift Roster; Time-in/Time-out logs.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Records showing work hours > 8 without overtime documentation.

legal_text: No worker shall be required or allowed to work, in any establishment or class of establishment for more than- (a) eight hours in a day...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are wages paid at twice the ordinary rate for any overtime work performed?
applicability_criteria: Applicable whenever a worker works beyond the prescribed daily or weekly hours.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify employees who have worked overtime.
2. Check wage slips and payroll records.
3. Calculate the rate paid for overtime hours.
4. Confirm it is exactly double the ordinary rate of wages.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Wage Slips; Overtime Register; Payroll Calculation Sheets.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Discrepancy between hours worked and wages paid; Payment at single rate.

legal_text: There shall be paid wages at the rate of twice the rate of wages in respect of overtime work, where a worker works in an establishment or class of establishment for more than such hours of work in any day or in any week as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government and the period of overtime work shall be calculated on a daily basis or weekly basis, whichever is more favourable to such worker...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the consent of the worker obtained prior to requiring them to work overtime?
applicability_criteria: Applicable whenever overtime work is required from an employee.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the company policy on overtime.
2. Verify if there is a mechanism (form/digital request) where workers consent to OT.
3. Interview workers to confirm they are not forced to work overtime against their will.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Signed overtime consent forms; Digital approval logs.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Employee complaints; Lack of consent records.

legal_text: Provided that a worker shall be required to work overtime by the employer subject to the consent of such worker for such work...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the Notice of Periods of Work displayed correctly and maintained at the establishment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments.
simplified_guidance:
1. Visit the main entrance or notice board area.
2. Check for the 'Notice of Periods of Work' (Form).
3. Ensure it shows start time, end time, rest intervals, and shift details.
4. Verify the information matches actual practice.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photograph of the displayed notice.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Absence of notice; Outdated shift timings on display.

legal_text: There shall be displayed and correctly maintained in every establishment a notice of periods of work, showing clearly for every day the periods during which workers may be required to work in accordance with the provisions of this Code.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are changes to the system of work intimated to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator before implementation?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when there is a change in shift timings or working periods.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if any changes to shifts/hours occurred recently.
2. Check if an intimation was sent to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator.
3. Ensure the intimation was sent before the change was made.
4. Verify if the change was implemented only after one week of intimation (unless sanctioned earlier).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of intimation letter/email to Inspector-cum-Facilitator.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Change in notice board without prior external intimation.

legal_text: Any proposed change in the system of work in any establishment which will necessitate a change in the notice referred to in sub-section (1) shall be intimated to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator before the change is made, and except with the previous sanction of the Inspector-cum-Facilitator, no such change shall be made until one week has elapsed since that last change.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the system of shifts arranged to ensure no overlapping relays of workers doing the same kind of work?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments running multiple shifts (excluding mines if exempted).
simplified_guidance:
1. Review the shift roster.
2. Check if Shift A workers and Shift B workers doing the same job are working simultaneously at the handover time.
3. Ensure distinct separation between relays unless exempted.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Shift Roster; Time logs showing distinct start/end times.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Observations of multiple relays working on the same machine simultaneously.

legal_text: The work shall not be carried on in any establishment by means of a system of shifts so arranged that more than one relay of workers is engaged in work of the same kind at the same time.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are measures in place to prevent double employment of workers who have worked in another factory/mine within the preceding 12 hours?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories and mines.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify worker declarations regarding other employment.
2. Ensure no worker is rostered if they are known to have completed a shift elsewhere recently.
3. Check for dual employment records if applicable.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Employee declarations; Shift records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Records showing the same person working continuous double shifts across entities.

legal_text: No worker shall be required or allowed to work in a mine or factory if he has already been working in any other such similar establishment within the preceding twelve hours, save in such circumstances as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is every worker allowed a weekly holiday, ensuring they do not work for more than six days in any one week?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments covered by the Code.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check the attendance register for the preceding months.
2. Verify that every worker has at least one day off in every period of seven days.
3. Ensure no worker has worked for more than 6 consecutive days without a rest day.
4. For motor transport, ensure specific exceptions (10 days) are strictly followed if applicable.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Attendance Register; Shift Schedule showing rest days.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Timesheets showing 7+ consecutive workdays.

legal_text: No worker shall be allowed to work in an establishment for more than six days in any one week: Provided that in any motor transport undertaking, an employer may... require a worker to work on any day of weekly holiday which is not a holiday so arranged that the worker does not work for more than ten days consecutively without a holiday for a whole day intervening.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are compensatory holidays granted within two months to workers deprived of any weekly holiday due to exemptions?
applicability_criteria: Applicable whenever a worker is deprived of a weekly holiday due to an order or exemption.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify instances where workers worked on their weekly holidays.
2. Check if a Compensatory Holiday was granted.
3. Verify that this holiday was given within the same month or the two months immediately following.
4. Ensure records of compensatory holidays are maintained.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Register of Compensatory Holidays; Attendance records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Records showing work on rest days without subsequent compensatory off.

legal_text: Where... a worker is deprived of any of the weekly holidays, the worker shall be allowed, within the month in which the holidays were due or within the two months immediately following that month, compensatory holidays of equal number to the holidays, so deprived.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are workers who have worked 180 days or more in a calendar year granted annual leave with wages at the prescribed rate?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all workers who meet the 180-day work threshold in a calendar year.
simplified_guidance:
1. verify the list of employees who worked 180+ days in the previous year.
2. Calculate leave entitlement: 1 day for every 20 days worked (1:15 for adolescents/underground mine workers).
3. Ensure leave accounts are credited accordingly.
4. Check that periods of layoff, maternity leave, and prior annual leave are counted towards the 180-day eligibility.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Leave with Wages Register; Attendance summary.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Leave balances not updated; Incorrect formula used for calculation.

legal_text: Every worker employed in an establishment shall be entitled for leave in a calendar year with wages subject to the following conditions, namely:-(i) that he has worked one hundred and eighty days or more in such calendar year; (ii) that he shall be entitled for one-day leave for every twenty days of his work...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the carry-forward of unavailed annual leave compliant with the maximum limit of thirty days?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all workers entitled to annual leave.
simplified_guidance:
1. Review the leave balances at the end of the calendar year.
2. Ensure unavailed leave is carried forward to the next year.
3. Verify that the carry-forward does not exceed 30 days (unless leave was refused by employer).
4. If leave was refused, ensure it is carried forward without limit.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Leave Register showing opening/closing balances.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Balances >30 days without refusal proof; Zeroing out balances without encashment.

legal_text: If such worker does not in any one calendar year take the whole of the leave allowed to him... any leave not taken by him shall be added to the leave to be allowed to him in the succeeding calendar year so that-(a) the total number of days of leave that may be carried forward to a succeeding year shall not exceed thirty days...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are wages in lieu of unavailed leave paid within the prescribed timeline upon discharge, dismissal, quitting, or superannuation?
applicability_criteria: Applicable whenever a worker's employment is terminated or they quit/retire.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify employees who left service (quit, dismissed, retired, died).
2. Check if they had unavailed earned leave balance.
3. Verify payment was made: (a) within 2 working days for discharge/dismissal/quitting; (b) within 2 months for superannuation/death.
4. Validate the calculation of wages for these days.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Full and Final Settlement records; Bank transfer proofs.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Late settlement dates; Unpaid leave balances in final accounts.

legal_text: In case such worker is discharged or dismissed from service or quits employment or is superannuated or dies while in service... such worker or his heir or nominee, shall be entitled to wages in lieu of the quantum of leave... and such payment shall be made-(a) where such worker is discharged or dismissed or quits employment before the expiry of the second working day... (b) where such worker is superannuated or dies while in service, before the expiry of two months...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the worker entitled to encash leave that exceeds the thirty-day carry-forward limit?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when a worker's leave balance exceeds 30 days at the end of the year.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check annual leave calculations at year-end.
2. Identify balances exceeding 30 days.
3. Ensure the excess days are encashed/paid out to the worker.
4. Verify the payment in payroll records.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Year-end payroll records showing leave encashment.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Lapsing of excess leave without payment.

legal_text: Such worker shall be entitled, where his total number of leave exceeds thirty days under sub-clause (a) of clause (vii), to encash such exceeded leave.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the employer maintain a register electronically or otherwise containing prescribed particulars of workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all employers of an establishment[cite: 808].
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify if a register of workers is maintained.
2. Ensure it contains details like work performed, hours of work, rest days, wages, leave, overtime, and adolescent employment.
3. Check if the register is updated regularly.
4. Confirm it is available in the prescribed form (electronic or physical).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Muster Roll/Register of Workers (Form D or similar prescribed form).
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Incomplete or missing worker entries.

legal_text: An employer of an establishment shall- (a) maintain register in prescribed form, electronically or otherwise, containing such particulars of workers as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government including,-(i) work performed by them; (ii) number of hours of work constituting normal working hours in a day; (iii) day of rest allowed in every period of seven days; (iv) wage paid and receipts given therefor; (v) leave, leave wages, overtime work, attendance and dangerous occurrences; and (vi) employment of adolescent;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are notices displayed at the workplace in the prescribed manner and form?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments[cite: 816].
simplified_guidance:
1. Inspect the notice board at the workplace entrance or common areas.
2. Verify that required notices (abstracts of the Code, wage rates, shift timings, etc.) are displayed.
3. Ensure notices are in English and the local language.
4. Check if notices are legible and up to date.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Photos of Notice Board; Physical check of displayed abstracts.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Empty notice board; Torn or outdated notices.

legal_text: An employer of an establishment shall... (b) display notices at the work place of the workers in such manner and form as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are wage slips issued to workers in electronic forms or otherwise?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments[cite: 817].
simplified_guidance:
1. Check payroll records for the previous month.
2. Verify that wage slips were generated for all employees.
3. Ensure wage slips are distributed electronically or physically.
4. Confirm wage slips contain relevant details (earnings, deductions, net pay).

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of issued wage slips; Acknowledgement from workers.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Workers reporting non-receipt of wage slips.

legal_text: An employer of an establishment shall... (c) issue wage slips to the workers, in electronic forms or otherwise;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer filed the return electronically or otherwise to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator within the prescribed period?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments required to file returns (typically annual or unified returns)[cite: 818].
simplified_guidance:
1. Determine the due date for the annual/periodic return.
2. Check if the return was filed electronically on the designated portal.
3. Verify the acknowledgement receipt or filing confirmation.
4. Ensure the data filed matches internal records.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Electronic Return Receipt; Copy of filed Annual Return.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Late filing fees paid; No filing record for previous year.

legal_text: An employer of an establishment shall... (d) file such return electronically or otherwise to the Inspector-cum-Facilitator in such manner and during such periods as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the contractor inform the principal employer electronically of wage amounts paid to contract labor?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to contractors employing contract labor[cite: 999].
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify if the contractor disburses wages via bank transfer/electronic mode.
2. Check for electronic communication from the contractor to the principal employer detailing amounts paid.
3. Ensure this intimation is sent after every wage disbursement.
4. Principal employer must retain these records for verification.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Email/Portal notifications from contractor to principal employer regarding wage payment.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Lack of correspondence; Principal employer unaware of payment status.

legal_text: Every contractor shall, make the disbursement of wages referred to in sub-section (1) through bank transfer or electronic mode and inform the principal employer electronically the amount so paid by such mode...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is an experience certificate issued to contract labor on demand?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to contractors employing contract labor[cite: 1003].
simplified_guidance:
1. Check if any contract worker requested an experience certificate.
2. Verify if the contractor issued the certificate in the prescribed form.
3. Ensure the certificate details the work performed.
4. Check for copies/acknowledgements of issued certificates.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of Experience Certificates issued.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Worker complaints regarding non-issuance.

legal_text: Every concerned contractor shall issue, on demand, experience certificate, in such form as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government, to the contract labour giving details of the work performed by such contract labour.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the employer obtained consent from women employees before employing them between 7 p.m. and 6 a.m.?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments employing women during night hours (7 p.m. to 6 a.m.).
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify women employees rostered for night shifts.
2. Verify that specific written consent was obtained from them prior to the shift.
3. Ensure all safety conditions (transport, security) prescribed by the Government are met.
4. Check that working hours and holidays are strictly observed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Signed consent forms from women employees; Shift rosters.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Rostering women for night shifts without consent records.

legal_text: Women shall be entitled to be employed in all establishments for all types of work under this Code and they may also be employed, with their consent before 6 a.m. and beyond 7 p.m. subject to such conditions relating to safety, holidays and working hours or any other condition to be observed by the employer as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are adequate safeguards provided prior to the employment of women in operations considered dangerous?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments conducting operations notified as dangerous for women by the Government.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check if any process in the establishment is notified as dangerous for women.
2. Verify that prescribed safeguards were implemented *before* women were employed in these roles.
3. Inspect the specific safety equipment or measures put in place.
4. Ensure women are trained on these safeguards.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Safety audit reports; List of safeguards implemented; Training records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Women working in hazardous zones without specific protective measures.

legal_text: Where the appropriate Government considers that the employment of women is dangerous for their health and safety... such Government may in the prescribed manner, require the employer to provide adequate safeguards prior to the employment of women for such operation.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the prohibition on employing persons below eighteen years of age in mines strictly enforced?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all Mines.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify the age proof of all workers employed in the mine.
2. Ensure no person under 18 is on the active worker roll.
3. Cross-reference with medical age certificates if age is disputed.
4. Confirm that apprentices (16-18) are governed by separate rules.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Age proof documents (Aadhaar/School Certificate); Register of employees.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Presence of underage workers; Lack of age verification documents.

legal_text: No person below eighteen years of age shall be allowed to work in any mine or part thereof.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are apprentices and trainees between 16 and 18 years of age working in mines under proper supervision?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Mines employing apprentices or trainees aged 16-18.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify any trainees/apprentices aged 16-18.
2. Verify the appointment of a supervisor for these individuals.
3. For trainees (non-apprentices), ensure prior approval from the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator was obtained.
4. Check supervision logs.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Supervision records; Approval letters for trainees from Inspector.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Unsupervised minors in mining areas.

legal_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in sub-section (1), apprentices and other trainees, not below sixteen years of age, may be allowed to work, under proper supervision, in a mine or part thereof by the manager: Provided that in the case of trainees, other than apprentices, prior approval of the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or an Inspector-cum-Facilitator shall be obtained before they are allowed to work.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has a Certificate of Fitness been obtained from a medical officer for every adolescent employed in factories, plantations, or motor transport undertakings?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories, plantations, and motor transport undertakings employing adolescents (14-18 years).
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify all adolescent workers.
2. Ensure they have undergone a medical examination by a certified Medical Officer.
3. Verify the Certificate of Fitness is valid and on file.
4. Ensure the adolescent works only in roles certified as safe.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Certificate of Fitness (Form); Medical examination records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Adolescents working without valid fitness certificates.

legal_text: The medical officer shall perform the following duties, namely:- ... (c) the examination and certification of adolescent for the purpose of ascertaining his fitness for employment in factory, plantation, motor transport undertakings and in any other establishment... in any work which is likely to cause injury to their health.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the contractor hold a valid licence issued by the designated authority for supplying or engaging contract labour?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to every contractor employing 50 or more contract labour (or as notified).
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify the number of contract workers supplied.
2. If 50 or more, check for a valid license from the designated authority.
3. Ensure the license covers the specific establishment/work order if applicable.
4. Check the validity period (typically 5 years) and renewal status.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Valid Contract Labour Licence (Form); Renewal receipts.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Expired license; Application pending beyond valid period.

legal_text: No contractor to whom this Part applies shall-(a) supply or engage contract labour in any establishment; or (b) undertake or execute the work through contract labour, except under and in accordance with a licence issued to him by the authority... after satisfying that the contractor fulfills such requisite qualifications or criteria...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is the engagement of contract labour restricted to non-core activities, unless specifically permitted?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to all establishments engaging contract labour.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify the 'core activities' of the establishment (essential to its function).
2. Ensure contract labour is NOT employed in these core activities.
3. Verify if exceptions apply (sudden volume increase, intermittent nature).
4. Review job descriptions of contract workers against core functions.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Job descriptions; List of core vs non-core activities; Contract agreements.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Contract workers performing main production/admin tasks permanently.

legal_text: Notwithstanding anything contained in this Part, employment of contract labour in core activities of any establishment is prohibited: Provided that the principal employer may engage contract labour through a contractor to any core activity, if-(a) the normal functioning of the establishment is such that the activity is ordinarily done through contractor...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the principal employer ensure that welfare facilities are provided to contract labour employed in the establishment?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to the principal employer of an establishment engaging contract labour.
simplified_guidance:
1. Verify that contract workers have access to welfare facilities (canteens, restrooms, drinking water, etc.).
2. Ensure these facilities meet the standards prescribed in Section 23 and 24.
3. Confirm that no discrimination exists between direct and contract employees regarding access.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Visual verification of facility access; Interviews with contract workers.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Contract workers denied access to canteens/restrooms.

legal_text: Welfare facilities specified under section 23 and section 24 shall be provided by the principal employer of the establishment to the contract labour who are employed in such establishment.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are wages paid to contract labour via bank transfer or electronic mode before the expiry of the prescribed period?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to contractors.
simplified_guidance:
1. Check wage registers and bank transfer statements.
2. Ensure wages are credited before the due date (e.g., 7th of the month).
3. Confirm payment is made electronically (cash only if specific exemption/impracticability exists).
4. Verify that the contractor intimated the principal employer of the payment.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Bank transfer logs; Wage slips; Intimation email to Principal Employer.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Cash payment receipts without justification; Late payment records.

legal_text: A contractor shall be responsible for payment of wages to each contract labour employed by him and such wages shall be paid before the expiry of such period as may be prescribed... Every contractor shall, make the disbursement of wages... through bank transfer or electronic mode...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the principal employer paid the wages in full or the unpaid balance if the contractor failed to do so?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Principal Employers when a contractor defaults on wage payment.
simplified_guidance:
1. Monitor contractor wage payments monthly.
2. If a default or short payment is identified, the principal employer must pay the workers directly.
3. Record such payments and recover them from the contractor's dues.
4. Maintain proof of direct payment to contract workers in default cases.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Proof of direct payment to workers; Debit notes to contractor.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Unpaid contract worker wages despite contractor default.

legal_text: In case the contractor fails to make payment of wages referred to in sub-section (1) within the prescribed period or makes short payment, then, the principal employer shall be liable to make payment of the wages in full or the unpaid balance due, as the case may be...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the contractor intimated the designated authority upon receiving a work order?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to contractors receiving work orders.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify new work orders received by the contractor.
2. Verify that an intimation was sent to the authority (Labor Department) within the prescribed time.
3. Check the acknowledgement or filing receipt.
4. Ensure details in the intimation match the work order.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copy of Intimation Form (Form VII or similar) submitted to authority.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Work started without intimating authorities.

legal_text: When a contractor receives work order from an establishment either to supply contract labour in the establishment or to execute the contract through contract labour in the establishment he shall, within such time and in such manner as may be prescribed, intimate to the authority referred to in section 119.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the principal employer ensured they are not employing contract labour through a non-licensed contractor?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to Principal Employers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Collect copies of licenses from all contractors before engagement.
2. Ensure the license is valid for the number of workers and the specific period.
3. Do not engage contractors who fail to produce a valid license.
4. Treat engagement through unlicensed contractors as a contravention.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Vendor Master list with License numbers; Copies of Contractor Licenses.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Invoices from contractors with no license on file.

legal_text: Where any principal employer of an establishment is employing contract labour through a contractor who is required to obtain a licence under this Part, but he has not obtained such licence, then, such employment shall be deemed to be in contravention of the provision of this Code.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the employer pay a lump sum journey allowance to every inter-State migrant worker annually for travel to and from their native place?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing 10 or more inter-State migrant workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify all inter-State migrant workers employed in the establishment.
2. Calculate the lump sum fare for to and fro journey to their native place based on entitlement rules.
3. Disburse this amount annually.
4. Maintain payment receipts or bank transfer records as proof.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Payment vouchers/Bank advice slips showing Journey Allowance; Worker acknowledgements.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Workers completing a year of service without travel allowance payment.

legal_text: The employer shall pay, to every inter-State migrant worker employed in his establishment, in a year a lump sum amount of fare for to and fro journey to his native place from the place of his employment, in the manner taking into account the minimum service for entitlement, periodicity and class of travel and such other matters as may be prescribed by the appropriate Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are inter-State migrant workers extended all benefits available to other workers, including ESIC, PF, and medical check-ups?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing 10 or more inter-State migrant workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Review the benefits package provided to regular workers (ESIC, PF, etc.).
2. Verify that inter-State migrant workers are enrolled in these schemes.
3. Ensure they receive medical check-ups as per Section 6(1)(c).
4. Check for any discrimination in benefits based on migrant status.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: PF/ESIC contribution rosters highlighting migrant workers; Medical check-up reports.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Migrant workers excluded from statutory benefit rolls.

legal_text: It shall be the duty of every contractor or the employer... (iii) to extend all benefits to such worker which are available to a worker of that establishment including benefits under the Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948... or the Employees' Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952... or any other law for the time being in force and the facility of medical check-up as available to a worker...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: In case of fatal accident or serious bodily injury to a migrant worker, are reports sent to the specified authorities of both States and the next of kin?
applicability_criteria: Applicable in the event of an accident involving an inter-State migrant worker.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if a fatal or serious accident involving a migrant worker occurred.
2. Notify the authorities in the State of employment.
3. Notify the authorities in the worker's native State.
4. Notify the worker's next of kin immediately.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of accident reports sent to both State authorities; Proof of communication to next of kin.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Accident recorded but no notification sent to Home State authorities.

legal_text: It shall be the duty of every contractor or the employer... (ii) in case of fatal accident or serious bodily injury to any such worker, to report to the specified authorities of both the States and also the next of kin of the worker;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Does the employer ensure suitable conditions of work for inter-State migrant workers?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to establishments employing 10 or more inter-State migrant workers.
simplified_guidance:
1. Assess the working conditions provided to migrant workers.
2. Ensure accommodation (if provided) and work environment consider their displacement status.
3. Verify compliance with hygiene, safety, and welfare standards specifically for this group.
4. Address grievances related to language barriers or cultural differences where possible.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Inspection reports of worker quarters (if applicable); Grievance records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Reports of substandard living or working conditions specific to migrants.

legal_text: It shall be the duty of every contractor or the employer... (i) to ensure suitable conditions of work to such worker having regard to the fact that he is required to work in a State different from his own State;

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the occupier disclosed all prescribed information regarding dangers and health hazards to workers, the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator, the local authority, and the general public?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to every factory involving a hazardous process.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify if the factory involves a hazardous process (First Schedule).
2. Compile information on dangers, health hazards, and safety measures.
3. Disclose this information to workers, authorities, and the public in the vicinity.
4. Maintain proof of disclosure/acknowledgement.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Copies of disclosure submissions to authorities; Proof of public notices; Worker acknowledgements.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Lack of receipt from local authority; No record of public communication.

legal_text: The occupier of every factory involving a hazardous process shall disclose in the manner prescribed by the State Government all information regarding dangers, including health hazards and the measures to overcome such hazards arising from the exposure to or handling of the materials or substances in the manufacture, transportation, storage and other processes, to the workers employed in the factory, the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or Inspector-cum-Facilitator, the local authority within whose jurisdiction the factory is situate and the general public in the vicinity.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the occupier laid down a detailed health and safety policy and intimated it to the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator and local authority?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to every factory involving a hazardous process.
simplified_guidance:
1. Draft a comprehensive Health and Safety Policy.
2. Submit the policy to the Chief Inspector and local authority at the time of registration or commencement.
3. Intimate any changes to the policy periodically as prescribed.
4. Ensure the policy is accessible to workers.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Written Health and Safety Policy; Receipt of submission to authorities.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Policy document not updated or submitted.

legal_text: The occupier shall, at the time of registering the factory involving a hazardous process, lay down a detailed policy with respect to the health and safety of the workers employed therein and intimate such policy to the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or Inspector-cum-Facilitator and the local authority and, thereafter, at such intervals as may be prescribed by the State Government, inform the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator or Inspector-cum-Facilitator and the local authority of any change made in the said policy.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has an on-site emergency plan and detailed disaster control measures been drawn up and approved?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to every factory involving a hazardous process.
simplified_guidance:
1. Prepare an on-site emergency plan detailing disaster control measures.
2. Obtain approval from the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator.
3. Communicate safety measures to workers and the general public in the vicinity.
4. Conduct mock drills to test the plan.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Approved On-Site Emergency Plan; Records of mock drills; Public awareness records.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Unapproved plan; No record of dissemination to public.

legal_text: Every occupier shall, with the approval of the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator, draw up an on-site emergency plan and detailed disaster control measures for his factory and make known to the workers employed therein and to the general public living in the vicinity of the factory the safety measures required to be taken in the event of an accident taking place.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are accurate and up-to-date health/medical records maintained for workers exposed to harmful substances?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes where workers are exposed to chemical/toxic substances.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify workers exposed to hazardous substances.
2. Maintain individual medical/health records for each exposed worker.
3. Ensure records are up-to-date and accessible to the workers.
4. Secure records to ensure privacy while allowing access as prescribed.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Health Register (Form 17 or equivalent); Medical examination reports.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Missing entries for recent periods; Denial of access to workers.

legal_text: Every occupier of a factory involving any hazardous process shall-(a) maintain accurate and up-to-date health records or, as the case may be, medical records, of the workers in the factory who are exposed to any chemical, toxic or any other harmful substances which are manufactured, stored, handled or transported and such records shall be accessible to the workers subject to such conditions as may be prescribed by the State Government;
