meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the occupier appointed qualified and competent persons to supervise the handling of hazardous substances?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories involving hazardous processes.
simplified_guidance:
1. Appoint supervisors with prescribed qualifications and experience for hazardous handling.
2. Ensure they are competent to oversee safety and provide protective facilities.
3. Verify that the number of supervisors is adequate for the operation.
4. Keep records of their qualifications and appointment.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Appointment letters; Qualification certificates of supervisors.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Supervisors lacking prescribed qualifications.

legal_text: Every occupier of a factory involving any hazardous process shall... (b) appoint persons who possess prescribed qualifications and experience in handling hazardous substances and are competent to supervise such handling within the factory and to provide at the working place all the necessary facilities for protecting the workers in the manner prescribed by the State Government...

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Is medical examination provided to every worker before assignment to a hazardous job and at intervals not exceeding twelve months?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to workers assigned to jobs involving handling/working with hazardous substances.
simplified_guidance:
1. Conduct pre-employment medical exams for workers entering hazardous roles.
2. Schedule periodic medical exams at least once every 12 months.
3. Retain records of fitness certifications.
4. Ensure exams are conducted by a qualified medical practitioner.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Medical examination certificates; Schedule of exams.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Workers in hazardous roles >12 months without re-examination.

legal_text: Every occupier of a factory involving any hazardous process shall... (c) provide for medical examination of every worker-(i) before such worker is assigned to a job involving the handling of, or working with, a hazardous substance; and (ii) while continuing in such job, and after he has ceased to work in such job, at intervals not exceeding twelve months, in such manner as may be prescribed by the State Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Are the permissible limits of exposure to chemical and toxic substances strictly adhered to?
applicability_criteria: Applicable to factories where chemical and toxic substances are present.
simplified_guidance:
1. Measure the levels of chemical/toxic substances in the work environment.
2. Compare results against prescribed permissible limits (Second Schedule/Rules).
3. Take immediate corrective action if limits are exceeded.
4. Maintain monitoring reports.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Workplace monitoring reports/Industrial hygiene surveys.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Reports showing exceedance without corrective action logs.

legal_text: The maximum permissible limits of exposure of chemical and toxic substances in manufacturing process in any factory shall be of the value as may be prescribed by the State Government.

meta_data.source_act: Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions Code, 2020

question_text: Has the occupier informed the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator about the nature and details of any new hazardous process within 30 days before commencement?
applicability_criteria: Applicable when a factory proposes to engage in a hazardous process after the Code's commencement.
simplified_guidance:
1. Identify plans to start a new hazardous process.
2. Compile details on the nature and process.
3. Inform the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator at least 30 days before starting.
4. Keep proof of this advance intimation.

evidence_requirements.compliance_proof: Intimation letter/form acknowledged by the Chief Inspector.
evidence_requirements.delay_proof: Process started less than 30 days after notice.

legal_text: Every occupier of a factory shall, if such factory proposes to engage in a hazardous process at any time after the commencement of this Code, within a period of thirty days before the commencement of such process, inform the Chief Inspector-cum-Facilitator about the nature and details of the process in such form and in such manner as may be prescribed by the State Government.
